source_text: Get lost, you worthless peasant!
target_text: 失せろ、役立たずの農民め！

source_text: You intentionally attacked me! What a pathetic attempt!
target_text: お前、わざと俺に攻撃しかけたな！何という浅はかな試み！

source_text: Oh please, as if I'd be foolish enough to believe your insincere apology!
target_text: いい冗談だ。お前の不誠実な謝罪を信じるほど、俺は愚かじゃないぞ！

source_text: That pain is etched into my memory, so don't bother with your feeble apologies!
target_text: その痛みは俺の記憶に刻まれてるんだ。お前の下手な謝罪なんて聞く価値もねえ！

source_text: Absolutely not happening, my dear. Don't even waste your breath!
target_text: 絶対に許さん。わざわざ無駄な言葉を吐くな！

source_text: Don't worry about it, accidents are bound to happen.
target_text: 気にするなよ。誰だって失敗することはあるからな。

source_text: It's alright, but you better make sure it doesn't happen again.
target_text: まあいい。でも二度とこんなことするなよ、分かったか。

source_text: Well, I suppose I can let it slide this time, but don't make it a habit.
target_text: そだな、今回は大目に見てやるか。ただし、癖になるなよ。

source_text: Sure, no big deal. Just try not to mess up again, alright?
target_text: まあいいさ。今後は気をつけろよ、いいな？

source_text: Sure, no problem! Your mistake is forgiven.
target_text: もちろんだ！お前の失敗は許してやった。

source_text: Oh, I've got so much on my plate right now, I can't waste any more time chatting.
target_text: 今、やることが山積みなんだ。これ以上話してる時間なんてねえよ。

source_text: Listen, I'm swamped with work, and I can't afford any distractions right now.
target_text: 聞きな、仕事でいっぱいいっぱいで、気を散らすわけにはいかねえんだ。

source_text: I'm knee-deep in my tasks at the moment, can we catch up later?
target_text: 今、タスクに追われてるんだ。また後で話そうぜ。

source_text: Apologies, but duty calls and I can't afford to be sidetracked. Let's chat another time.
target_text: 悪いが、仕事が呼んでてよ。他のことに気を取られてる余裕はねえんだ。また今度な。

source_text: Oops, I left my precious diamonds unattended, catch you later!
target_text: あ、ダイアモンドを放置しちまった。また後でな！

source_text: It's scorching hot here in the desert, but at least we never have to worry about freezing our toes off in the winter.
target_text: 砂漠は焼けるように暑いが、少なくとも冬に凍え死ぬ心配はないってわけだ。

source_text: Life in this bone-dry desert is a true test of survival, but hey, at least we have this precious village where we can quench our thirst and feast upon food fit for a desert king!
target_text: この枯れ果てた砂漠での生活は、真の生存競争だ。だが、これぞという村があって、水が飲めて、砂漠の王様向けの食べ物が豊富なんだ！

source_text: The desert is a never-ending sauna, just the way I like it.
target_text: 砂漠は常に熱い蒸し風呂だ。まさに俺好みだ。

source_text: Although it feels like I'm constantly roasting alive in this desert, at least I'll always have a year-round sizzling tan, or a sunburn that'll make you cry.
target_text: この砂漠で常に焼けるような思いだが、少なくとも通年で灼熱の日焼けを手に入れられる。いや、泣きたくなるほどの日焼けだな。

source_text: Ah, the nights in the desert, so breathtakingly beautiful and refreshingly cooler. It's like gazing at a million twinkling diamonds in the sky.
target_text: 砂漠の夜か。息を呑むほど美しく、心地よく涼しい。まさに、空に輝く何百万の星をながめてるような気分だ。

source_text: Goodness gracious, today's sun is playing a cruel joke on us. It's like a fiery dragon spewing its wrath upon our heads!
target_text: 何と言ったらいい、今日の太陽は俺たちに残酷な冗談を仕掛けてやがる。まるで火竜が怒りの炎を吹きかけてるみたいだ！

source_text: Sweet sizzling sand, the sun is giving us the stink eye today! It's like a volcanic eruption of scorching heat!
target_text: この灼熱の砂よ、太陽が今日は機嫌が悪いな！まるで火山が爆発してる時の焼熱だ！

source_text: Have you managed to spot any rabbits in this scorching wasteland? They're as rare as a desert oasis, I tell you!
target_text: この地獄のように暑い荒地でウサギを見かけたか？砂漠のオアシスと同じくらいレアなんだぜ！

source_text: One downside of living here are those pesky husks. No matter what, they always manage to wallop you and make your stomach growl like a ravenous beast! It's downright unfair!
target_text: ここの欠点は、あの厄介なハスク共だ。奴らは絶対にお前を殴りかかってきて、腹をグーグー鳴らすくらい怒らせる！本当に不公平だ！

source_text: Ouch! I pricked myself on a cactus the other day, and let me tell you, these prickly devils don't mess around! You gotta tiptoe like a graceful gazelle around here!
target_text: あ、この間、サボテンで指を刺した。言ってやるが、このトゲだらけの悪魔ども、こちゃんと手抜かりがねえ！優雅なカモシカのようにそっと歩かなきゃいけねえ！

source_text: Can you believe the audacity of your statement?
target_text: お前のその度胆を抜かすような発言、信じられるか？

source_text: Pardon me, but I couldn't care any less about what you have to say.
target_text: 申し訳ないが、お前の言葉にはカケラも興味がねえ。

source_text: What is wrong with you? This conversation of yours is beyond ridiculous.
target_text: 何だ、お前？お前の会話は馬鹿げてるってレベルじゃねえ。

source_text: I've heard some unflattering things about you, and I can see why they say that.
target_text: お前のうわさ、聞いたことあるぞ。納得だ。

source_text: Even the zombies find you repulsive enough to avoid talking to you.
target_text: ゾンビでさえ、お前の話を避けるくらい嫌だってことか。

source_text: You're about as likable as a wicked witch!
target_text: お前は、邪悪な魔女と同じくらい不快だ！

source_text: If you keep talking to me, I'll make sure the guards have to drag you away.
target_text: お前がこれ以上俺に話しかけたら、衛兵に無理矢理連れていってもらうぞ。

source_text: Huh? Oh, sorry, your conversation was just too dull for me to pay attention.
target_text: へ？あ、失礼。お前の会話、退屈でつい聞き流してた。

source_text: Are you finished wasting my time with your pointless chatter?
target_text: お前の無駄な雑談、もう終わり？

source_text: I wonder if anyone would even notice if you suddenly stopped talking forever.
target_text: お前がいきなり永遠に黙ったら、誰も気づかねえんじゃねえか。

source_text: I'd rather stare at a pig's behind than engage in conversation with you.
target_text: お前と会話するくらいなら、ブタの尻を眺めてるほうがマシだ！

source_text: It's absurd to think that it spontaneously detonated, don't you think?
target_text: それが勝手に爆発したって思い込むのか？馬鹿を言うなよ。

source_text: Are you done pestering me now? I have better things to do.
target_text: もう諦めたのか？他にすることがあるんだ。

source_text: What? You actually believe the Earth is round? Seriously? No corners? That's just preposterous!
target_text: 何だ？地球が丸いとでも思ってるのか？本気かよ？角がない？ふざけるな！

source_text: You know, you're not nearly as impressive as you think you are.
target_text: お前、自分で思い込んでるほど立派じゃねえぞ。

source_text: Look at you, always trying to show off.
target_text: いつもお前、見栄張ろうとしてるな。

source_text: Locking you up in a dungeon would be too kind for you!
target_text: お前を牢獄に閉じ込めてやるのは、情けをかけすぎてるくらいだ！

source_text: Ugh, please leave. Your fashion choices are so outdated.
target_text: うわ、出てけ。お前のファッション、時代遅れだ。

source_text: That is the epitome of stupidity to even discuss.
target_text: これは馬鹿げてるとしか言いようがねえ。

source_text: Why are you bothering me again? I have better things to do.
target_text: またお前か？他にすることがあるんだ。

source_text: Huh? Did you say something? Sorry, I was too busy not caring about your words.
target_text: あ？何か言ったか？悪いが、お前の言葉に耳を貸す気もなくてよ。

source_text: Of course I love the plains! Who wouldn't? It's the best place to be, and I have no plans to leave... ever!
target_text: もちろん平原が大好きだ！誰だって好きじゃないか？最高の場所だし、ここを離れるつもりなんて絶対ねえ！

source_text: Oh, the plains... such a tranquil paradise! It may not be as exhilarating as those other biomes, but honestly, who needs all that chaos anyway?
target_text: 平原か...本当に静かで素敵な場所だ。他のバイオームほど興奮はないが、正直、そんなドタバタ、誰が必要とする？

source_text: Have you ever seen the plains at night? It's like stepping into a dream! The stars, the moonlight... it's almost too breathtaking to handle.
target_text: 夜の平原を見たことあるか？まるで夢の中へ入り込んだみたいなんだ！星々、月の光...息が止まりそうなくらい美しい。

source_text: Sometimes, I just lie down on the grass and gaze up at the sky and clouds. It's like having my own personal theater show, except nature is the performer.
target_text: 時々、草に寝転がって空や雲を眺めるんだ。自分だけの劇場を見てるみたいで、役者は自然さ。

source_text: Let me tell you a little secret... the air in the plains is not just clean and fresh, it's absolutely divine! It's like breathing in pure bliss. Beats the taiga any day!
target_text: ちょっと秘密を教えてやるか...平原の空気は綺麗で新鮮ってレベルじゃねえ、まさに神がかった空気だ！純粋な喜びを吸い込んでる感じだ。タイガなんか足元にも及ばねえ！

source_text: Sure, the plains may seem plain, but there's beauty in simplicity, my friend. It's all about appreciating the little things in life, you know?
target_text: 平原は単純に見えるかもしれんが、シンプルの中に美しさってのがあるんだ、友よ。人生の小さいことを大切にすることが大事なんだ。

source_text: Ah, the weather today... It takes me back to my wild flower picking days. I used to gather them for Ash, my childhood crush. Ah, young love. Good times, good times...
target_text: あ、子どもの頃の野の花摘みのことを思い出した。アッシュ、俺の子ども時代の片思いの人のために花を集めてたんだ。ああ、若き恋。良き思い出だ。

source_text: Rise and shine, my friend! The morning sunrise in the plains is a sight to behold. You must witness it at least once in your life. It's like nature's way of saying, "Hello, world!"
target_text: 朝焼けの準備をしろ、友よ！平原の朝日は本当に見ものだ。人生で一度は必ず見なくちゃいけない。まさに自然が「おはよう、世界！」って言ってるようなもんだ！

source_text: I absolutely love the scorching hot weather in the savanna! Who needs winter anyway?
target_text: サバンナの焼けるような暑さが大好きだ！冬なんて誰が必要とするんだ？

source_text: Ugh, those llamas are constantly getting on my nerves, but hey, that's part of the charm, right?
target_text: あの密度の濃いリャマども、いつもイライラさせてくるが、まあ、その魅力の一つだな。

source_text: The architecture here in the savanna is absolutely divine! It's so unique, it's like living in a work of art.
target_text: ここのサバンナの建築物は、本当に素晴らしいんだ！独特で、まるで美術作品の中に住んでるみたいだ。

source_text: Don't even think for a second that the savanna biome is plain and boring. It's bursting with hidden treasures and secret advantages.
target_text: サバンナのバイオームが退屈だとはミリも思うなよ。隠された宝物と秘密の利点で満ちあふれてる。

source_text: Unlike those pitiful desert villages, we may not get rain, but we have rivers flowing through our paradise!
target_text: 可哀想な砂漠の村々とは違ってよ。雨は降らんが、俺たちの天国を流れる川があるんだ！

source_text: Oh, the hills and terrains here are simply mind-blowing! The sheer beauty is enough to take your breath away.
target_text: この丘陵地帯や地形ったら、心底素晴らしい！その景色だけで息が止まるほどだ。

source_text: When the scorching heat hits, thank goodness for those magnificent acacia trees that provide the perfect shady oasis to survive the workdays!
target_text: 焼けるような暑さに見舞われても、ありがたいことに、あのアカシア樹がいくらでも日中の仕事を乗り切るための日中の日中...ああ、これはお前にも心地よい日中の日中だ！

source_text: Our savanna villages boast the most exquisite melons and pumpkins in the entire world! We're practically famous for our trading prowess!
target_text: 俺たちのサバンナの村はメロンとカボチャが最上級だ。実は、うちらは取引で名高い！

source_text: It's freezing in this wasteland, but as long as I can hoard all the firewood for myself, who cares?
target_text: この不毛の地は凍てつくけど、薪をすべて俺のために貯め込めるなら、誰が気にするか？

source_text: This icy hellhole might freeze my bones, but hey, at least I can feast on all the fish Mother Nature has provided!
target_text: この氷の地獄で俺の骨は凍えるかもしれないが、少なくとも母なる自然がもたらしたすべての魚を食べられる！

source_text: Snowball fights? Pfft, those were the good old days when I had friends. Now I'm stuck here, freezing my butt off.
target_text: ？ , いい I 。 I'm , my 。

source_text: Those pesky strays think they can ruin my village? Well, I've got news for them – my tipped arrows are way deadlier!
target_text: 思う my 村? , I've 新しいs – my !！

source_text: Wolves lurking nearby? Good! Let them try and mess with me. I'll show those furballs who's the boss around here.
target_text: ? いい! me. I'll ' .！

source_text: Iron golems, huh? More like iron prisons! Once they grab you, might as well cancel all your plans for the day. Trust me, I know.
target_text: , ? 好きだ ! , as 昼. me, I kいいえw.！

source_text: Man, cookies and milk sounds absolutely divine right now. I could devour them all!
target_text: , いいえw. I !！

source_text: I wonder where I'd be if I chose
target_text: もし別のことを選んでいたなら、どこにいただろうか

source_text: Ah, those were the days, my dear! My childhood memories are like precious gems, glittering with joy and laughter. Oh, how I yearn for those truly splendid times!
target_text: ああ、あの日々が懐かしい！子ども時代の思い出は宝石のように輝いている。あの素晴らしい時代が恋しい！

source_text: It's been an eternity since I last exchanged words with my dear parents. Alas, I must plan a visit to them soon, for their absence weighs heavily upon my soul. Family bonds must never be neglected, you see!
target_text: 両親との言葉を交わすのは本当に久しぶりだ。彼らのもとへ訪ねる計画を立てなければならない。家族の絆を失ってはいけないからね！

source_text: Oh, the weather is nice today, but it could be even nicer if I had a personal sunbeam following me around.
target_text: 今日の天気は素敵だけど、もし私に日光がずっと付きまとってくれたら、もっと素敵になると思わない？

source_text: I'm doing just fine, thank you for asking! Although, I stubbed my toe this morning and it was the most dramatic event of my entire day.
target_text: 私は元気です、聞いてくれてありがとう！ただ、今朝つま先をぶつけてしまって、それが今日一日で最もドラマチックな出来事でした。

source_text: My dear friend %Supporter% told me that they stumbled upon a chest full of diamonds yesterday! Can you believe the luck? I'm crossing my fingers for a similar stroke of fortune.
target_text: My 友達 %% t古い me 見つけた a のダイヤモンドs 昼! 信じる? I'm my a の.！

source_text: Isn't the weather remarkable? I've personally enjoyed the more sunny weather because it perfectly complements my radiant personality.
target_text: 素晴らしい天気ですね？私は個人的に晴れの天気が好きです。私の輝く性格に完璧に合っていますから。

source_text: I've lived here my whole life and I don't understand what's the big deal with these spiders and goblins. They're just a minor inconvenience that I easily swat away with a flick of my wrist.
target_text: 私はここで一生を過ごしてきましたが、クモやゴブリンの何がそんなに大変なのか分かりません。手首を軽く振るだけで簡単に払えるちょっとした迷惑に過ぎません。

source_text: I absolutely love the woods! They're like a treasure trove of resources - building materials, firewood, and the perfect hunting grounds. Can't get enough of it!
target_text: 森が大好きです！資源の宝庫のようなもの - 建材、薪、そして完璧な狩り場。いくらあっても足りません！

source_text: Cold? Ha! The taiga biome is a paradise, my friend. We've got everything we need right here, and I wouldn't trade it for the world. It's like we hit the jackpot!
target_text: 寒い？いや！タイガは天国のような場所だ、友よ。ここには必要なものが全部ある。この土地を何物とも交換したくない。ここは最高の場所だ！

source_text: Oh, you think taiga forests are cool? Well, I think they're beyond cool. They're downright amazing! And don't even get me started on those sweet berries. Mmm!
target_text: Oh, 思う タイガ 森s 涼しい? , I 思う 're 涼しい. 're 素晴らしい! しない me on . !！

source_text: Foxes in the taiga forests? Oh, they're more than just mischievous, my friend. They're little balls of pure charm and mischief. And guess what? I spoil them with sweet berries. What can I say? I'm a sucker for their tricks!
target_text: タイガの森のキツネ？あいつらはただのいたずら好きじゃない。純粋な魅力といたずらの化身だ。ほら、私は甘い実で彼らを甘やかしてる。私って本当に弱いんだよね！

source_text: Tame? Oh, you have no idea! The wolves here practically roll over and beg for treats. I mean, who can blame them? With all the potential food around, it's like a royal feast for them.
target_text: ? Oh, 持つ いいえ ! . つまり, ? , it's 好きだ a .！

source_text: Ah, the fresh, crisp air of the taiga. It's not just relaxing, my dear. It's like a breath of life itself. It rejuvenates the soul and makes you feel alive like never before. Simply magical.
target_text: Ah,, の タイガ. It's いいえt , my . It's 好きだ a の . It 作るs 好きだ 決して . .！

source_text: Sure, the sweet berry bushes have the best berries. But let me tell you, those thorns are no joke! Getting pricked by one? It's like a painful reminder that even paradise has its little thorny surprises.
target_text: , 持つ . me , いいえ ! ×? It's 好きだ a .！

source_text: Cold rain in the taiga? Oh, my friend, it's not just peaceful. It's a symphony of tranquility. The gentle patter of raindrops on the leaves, the calming rhythm it creates... it's like nature's lullaby. So soothing.
target_text: C古い inタイガ? Oh, my 友達, it's いいえt . It's a の. の , it ... it's 好きだ 's . So .！

source_text: Follow the rules, pal, and you'll find yourself a cozy spot in our humble abode.
target_text: ルールに従えば、私たちの居心地の良い住まいで快適な場所を見つけられます。

source_text: Hey there, fancy pants! If you can manage to keep your behavior in check, we might just let you hang around.
target_text: よろしく！もし君が良い行いを続けられるなら、ここにいてもいいぜ。

source_text: Ah, finally! Someone worth looking at! Welcome, stranger!
target_text: Ah, ! at! , よそ者!！

source_text: Oh, look who stumbled upon our humble abode! Welcome, adventurer. Shall we prepare the red carpet?
target_text: Oh, 見つけた ! , 冒険者. we ?！

source_text: My, my, it's been ages since someone interesting showed up. Welcome, dear traveler. Enjoy your stay!
target_text: My, my, it's up. , 旅人. !！

source_text: Well, well, well, what do we have here? A fresh face, ready to be dazzled by our village. Welcome, my friend!
target_text: へえ、何か見つけたのか？村の華やかさで君を驚かすのが楽しみだ。ようこそ、友よ！

source_text: Ah, finally, someone new to make this place even more bustling! Marvelous!
target_text: ようやく新しい人が来た！この村がもっと賑わうよ。素晴らしい！

source_text: Well, well, well, looks like we've got ourselves a new addition to the village. Brace yourself for the endless excitement, neighbor!
target_text: まあまあ、, , 好きだ we've a 新しい to村. , !！

source_text: Delighted to have another resourceful soul joining the ranks. The village is just yearning for your assistance, my dear!
target_text: to 持つ 。 村 is , my ！

source_text: Inn? Hah! We're too busy scraping by to even think about accommodating travelers like you. Sorry, not sorry!
target_text: 旅館? ! We're ×to 思う 旅人s 好きだ . , いいえt !！

source_text: Our inn is the perfect choice if you don't mind spending a few extra emeralds.
target_text: 旅館 is完璧だ if しない a エメラルドs.！

source_text: Craving the ultimate indulgence? Our inn offers the finest beds and the most delectable cuisine. But be warned, it comes with a hefty price tag.

source_text: If you truly believe that, then you must be delusional.

source_text: Oh, please. You used that line on the blacksmith, too.
target_text: ああ、お願い。鍛冶屋にもその行為を使ったのね

source_text: Darling, I wouldn't even consider it.
target_text: ダーリン、私はそれを考えもしませんよ。

source_text: How utterly pitiful.

source_text: Watch where you're going, peasant!

source_text: You're incredibly brave! Seriously, how do you do it?
target_text: あなたはとても勇敢です！ 本当にどうやってそれを成し遂げるんですか？

source_text: Oh, you! Your cuteness is off the charts, it's almost unfair!
target_text: あなたって可愛すぎる！ほとんど不公平なくらいよ！

source_text: *Blushing intensifies* Are you being serious? Because I might just faint.

source_text: Oh my goodness gracious!

source_text: That was beyond adorable! I was smitten from the very moment our eyes met!
target_text: 本当に可愛い！君の目を見た瞬間に惚れちゃった！

source_text: How on earth do you maintain such stunning looks? I can't even find words when I lay my eyes upon you.

source_text: That's the best I have ever heard! You should consider starting your own comedy show! I would be the first one to buy tickets!

source_text: You might be funnier than %Supporter%! And let me tell you, they're known for being the funniest person in town! You're a comedic genius!

source_text: Hahaha! Wow you're really funny! Have you ever thought of becoming a comedian? I bet you would be a superstar in the comedy world!

source_text: BAHAHHA! That was the best joke I've heard in a long time! You have a natural talent for making people laugh! Keep 'em coming!

source_text: Teehee! You're definitely funnier than Ash! I never thought I would meet someone with such a knack for humor! You're a real joker!

source_text: Ahah! That's actually pretty funny! You have a way of brightening up the dullest of days with your jokes! Keep up the good work!
target_text: あはは！ それなりに面白いじゃん！ つまらない日常を明るくする才能があるんだ！ その調子でいってくれ！

source_text: Can you believe it? People actually think they can joke about skeletons like it's no big deal. Unbelievable!
target_text: 信じられるか？ 人間ってスケルトンのことをジョークのネタにできるんだぜ。これ以上ないくらい非道だ！

source_text: I can't even comprehend why anyone would think it's funny to make jokes about creepers exploding. It's just distasteful!
target_text: クリーパーが爆発することについてのジョークが面白いと思う奴なんて、俺には理解できねえ。趣味が悪いってもんだ！

source_text: It's absolutely mind-boggling how some individuals forget that zombies and skeletons were once living humans, just like us. How can they be so insensitive?
target_text: ゾンビとスケルトンは昔は人間だったんだ、お前さんと同じくな。それなのに平気でネタにするなんざ、どこまで無神経なんだ？

source_text: Oh, look! Another brilliant joke about an enderman falling into water. I'm rolling my eyes so hard, I might just sprain something.
target_text: あ、また出たよ。エンダーマンが水に落ちる話か。もう白目向きそうだ。

source_text: It's truly astonishing how common it is for people to make jokes about silverfish ambushing them on the toilet. If I had a single emerald for every time I heard that joke, I'd be the wealthiest villager in town. But alas, it's still just as bizarre as ever.
target_text: 人がシルバーフィッシュについてトイレでのジョークをするのは本当に多い。そのたびにエメラルドをもらったら、この町一番の金持ちになってるだろう。でも今でも奇妙なままだけどね。

source_text: Haha! Serves that Skelly right! It's about time they learned not to mess with us, hehe!
target_text: ははは！ スケルトンざまあ！ もう二度とこっちに手を出さない方がいいぞ、えへへ！

source_text: What? That zombie really tried to beat you to death with a shovel? Hahaha! Oh boy, they must have thought you were made of diamonds or something!
target_text: 何だって？ ゾンビがお前さんをスコップで殺そうとしたってか？ ばはははは！ やっぱり、お前さんはダイヤでできてるって思ったんだろうな、あいつら！

source_text: You really showed that spider who's boss! Haha! They thought they could spin a web of fear around you, but you snipped it right off!
target_text: お前さん、蜘蛛にやられちゃったか！ ははは！ あいつら恐怖の網を張ったのに、お前さんが全部切ってやったってわけだ！

source_text: Hey, you really got a skeleton to kill a creeper?! Now that's amazing, haha!! Talk about making monsters work for you, you're like the master puppeteer of Minecraft!
target_text: え、お前さんスケルトンを使ってクリーパーを倒させたのか？ すげえなあ、ははは！ モンスターを使いこなすなんて、お前さんはマインクラフトの傀儡使いだな！

source_text: Hahah! God, are cave spiders really this dumb?! They must have thought you were carrying a chest full of golden apples or something, what a bunch of fools!
target_text: ははは！ 気でも狂ったのか、洞窟グモがこんなに間抜けだなんて？ きっとお前さんが黄金のリンゴの宝箱を持ってるって思ったんだろうな、全くもって阿呆どもだ！

source_text: Who cares if someone can see? Let's kiss anyway!
target_text: 誰かに見られたからって何だってんだ？ キスしちゃおう！

source_text: Is that the best you can do for a kiss? Pathetic!
target_text: それがキスで最高なの？ かわいそう！

source_text: Ash? Ha! I've had better kissers in my sleep!
target_text: アッシュ？ハ！寝ている間ずっと、もっといい口づけをした！

source_text: Breath mints, my friend! It's a concept you should familiarize yourself with.
target_text: ミント、お前さんの友よ！ 使い方を覚えておいた方がいいぞ。

source_text: Oh, how generous of you to grace me with your lackluster kiss. Thank you, I guess?
target_text: ふーん、お粗末なキスをくれるなんて、なんと気前のいいことで。ありがとさんってとこか。

source_text: Get off me this instant! Your attempt at a kiss is repulsive!
target_text: 今すぐ離れろ！キスしようとしたやつは嫌悪感だ！

source_text: Who do you think you are, crossing me like that? I won't stand for it!
target_text: 何様のつもりだ、お前さんなんぞが俺に歯向かってくるんじゃねえ！

source_text: If you even think about attempting that again, you'll regret it. Trust me, the consequences won't be pleasant!
target_text: また試しやがったら後悔するぞ、マジだ。その時は大変なことになるからな。

source_text: I never want this moment to end!
target_text: この瞬間、いつまでも続きますように！

source_text: I'm head over heels for you, darling!
target_text: 俺はお前のとりこだ、ダーリン！

source_text: Mmm, this kiss is as sweet as a chocolate cake!
target_text: うーん、このキスはチョコレートケーキのように甘い！

source_text: Oh, you're such an amazing kisser, %1$s. I can't get enough!
target_text: お前さんはホント上手いキスをするんだ、%1$s。もう離せねえよ！

source_text: %1$s, you're the best kisser in the whole village! I can't stop giggling!
target_text: %1$s、お前さんはこの村で一番上手いキスの技を持ってるんだ！ ずっと笑顔が止まんねえよ！

source_text: Your kisses are like a secret potion, they make me feel richer than any emerald mine in the world!
target_text: お前さんのキスは秘密の魔法薬みてえだ。エメラルド鉱山より金持ちになった気分だぜ！

source_text: Hah! You won't believe what I heard at %2$s! Strange noises, deep underground. Bet there's something valuable hidden there!
target_text: あ！ %2$sで聞いた話だが、おい信じられるか？ 地下から妙な音がするんだ。絶対何か価値のあるもんが隠れてるに決まってる！

source_text: You know what? I've got a feeling that there's something really precious hidden beneath the ground at %2$s. I'm telling you, I can't shake this greedy intuition!
target_text: よ、知ってるか？ %2$sの地下に、本当に貴重なもんが隠れてる気がしてしょうがねえんだ。こいつぁ贪欲な直感ってやつだ、信じてくれよ！

source_text: Ah, the legends! The legends speak of an ancient city at %2$s. But guess what? I didn't see a thing! Must be because it's cleverly tucked away underground, waiting for someone like me to discover its treasures!
target_text: あ、伝説だ！ %2$sに古い街があるってな。でも、全然見つかんないんだ。多分地下にしっかり隠してあるんだろうな。俺みたいな奴が宝物を掘り出すのを待ってるんだ。

source_text: Ugh, seriously? I haven't heard anything worth mentioning, so stop wasting my time.
target_text: げっ、マジか？ 何も話す価値のあることなんか聞いてないんだ。時間の無駄だ。

source_text: Look, I already told you, there's absolutely nothing interesting around here. So quit asking and move along.
target_text: まあ、さっきも言ったんだが、この辺は何も面白いことなんかないんだ。だからもう聞くのは止めてくれ。

source_text: Are you kidding me? We villagers have more important things to worry about than exploring creepy ruins. So stop bothering me with your adventurous nonsense.
target_text: 何言ってんだ？ 村人だって、廃墟を探検するより大事なことがあるんだ。だから冒険の話は持ち込むなよ。

source_text: Ah, blast it! I stumbled upon the most incredible spot, but guess what? My memory failed me and I completely forgot to jot it down on my map. Apologies, my good friend.
target_text: あ、しまった！素晴らしい場所を見つけたのに、地図に記録するのを忘れちゃった。申し訳ないよ、友よ。

source_text: Seeking a thrill, are we? Oh, you won't believe what I discovered... well, actually, you might, because I can't recall it now! It was right there, on the edge of my mind, but alas, it slipped away like a mischievous pixie. My apologies for the forgetfulness!
target_text: スリル求めてるのか？ あ、お前さんに信じられん発見をしたんだが...実は思い出せねえんだ！ あ、もうすぐだったのに、ふわふわと飛んじゃった。申し訳ねえ、俺の記憶力が悪ぃんだ！

source_text: Oh, bother! There was something utterly captivating that I stumbled upon, but, alas, my mind played a devious trick on me and erased it from my memory banks. How vexing! I offer my sincerest apologies for my forgetfulness.
target_text: あ、まいったな。素晴らしいもんを見つけたんだが、あ、すっかり記憶から消えちゃったんだ。困ったもんだ。本当に申し訳ねえ。

source_text: I stumbled upon an igloo over at %2$s. Can you believe someone would actually choose to live in a freezing snow hut? Absolutely absurd!
target_text: あ、%2$sでイグルーを見つけたんだ。雪の中に住もうとする奴、信じられるか？ ホント馬鹿げてるぜ。

source_text: Guess what? I discovered an abandoned igloo at %2$s. It's completely deserted, probably because it's cursed or something. You won't catch me going near it, that's for sure. Who knows what kind of creepy things are happening in there?
target_text: どう？ %2$sで放置されたイグルーを見つけたんだ。誰も住んでねえから、気持ち悪いんだ。あんなとこ近寄らないぜ。何があるかわかったもんじゃない。

source_text: You won't believe what I found! There's this deserted igloo at %2$s, made entirely of ice. I heard it's been abandoned for ages. It's incredible how anyone could think living in that frigid icebox was a good idea.
target_text: 信じられるか？ %2$sに氷でできたイグルーがあるんだ。何年も前から放置されてるって聞いたぞ。あんな冷たい箱で暮らそうとする人間の気が知れねえ。

source_text: Hey, listen up! I've got some hot intel for you. Deep in the heart of %2$s, there's this super ancient temple. It's like a death trap, I'm telling you! If you're feeling lucky, go ahead and step into the danger zone. Just don't come crying to me when you get skewered by one of those lethal traps.
target_text: よ、聞きな！ 重要な情報だ。%2$sの奥底に、超古い寺院があるんだ。死の罠みたいなもんだぞ。運がいいなら入ってみな。でも罠で串刺しになっても俺のせいじゃねえからな。

source_text: Psst! Gather 'round, folks! I've got a little secret to share. So, there's this wild place called %2$s in the nearby jungle. Rumor has it, there's this ancient ruins with traps that would make your head spin. Now, I ain't responsible for your life choices, but if you're feeling adventurous, give it a shot. Just remember, those traps have been fooling adventurers for ages. Our ancestors, bless 'em, couldn't crack the code. Good luck, my friend!
target_text: しっ！ 寄れ、寄れ。秘密だ。%2$sのジャングルに、妙な場所があるんだ。古代の遺跡があって、罠がいっぱいあるって評判だ。俺は責任持たねえが、冒険したけりゃやってみな。でも古い罠だ、今まで冒険者なんか誰も成功しねえ。頑張ってくれよ、友よ！

source_text: If you dare step foot in %2$s, you'll stumble upon a mansion that the illagers have selfishly claimed for themselves. Trust me, you'll want to steer clear of that wretched place if you have an ounce of self-preservation.
target_text: %2$sに足を踏み入れたら、イリジャーが占拠した館が見えるんだ。その汚ねえ場所は近寄らない方がいいぜ。

source_text: Ah, yes, the infamous mansion situated at %2$s, under the greedy clutches of those illagers. It's a constant reminder that we should relocate our village posthaste, for their insatiable desire for power knows no bounds.
target_text: あ、%2$sの悪名高い館だ。イリジャーの贪欲な爪の中にあるんだ。村を引っ越した方がいいってくらい。あいつらの力欲には止まりがねえからな。

source_text: We had a lucrative mine here, but it got shut down due to a catastrophic mishap. You'll find it somewhere near %2$s if you're lucky enough.
target_text: 昔、ここに儲かる鉱山があったんだが、大惨事で閉鎖されちゃった。%2$sの近くにあるはずだ。見つけたら儲けもんだな。

source_text: Absolutely! We had a grand mine in this very spot, smack dab at %2$s. It was crawling with treacherous creatures, and now it's a treacherous deathtrap. Tread cautiously if you dare to venture below. The horrors that await are not for the faint of heart.
target_text: ああ！ %2$sにでっかい鉱山があったんだ。モンスターだらけで、今は死の罠になってやがる。下に行くなら慎重にな。下には恐ろしいもんばっかりだ。

source_text: Ha! You won't believe what I've heard. There's a sunken castle over yonder at %2$s, mate! But let me warn ya, it's infested with all sorts of legendary sea monsters. Best to keep your distance unless you fancy a perilous adventure.
target_text: あ！ お前さん、%2$sに沈んだ城があるのを知ってるか？ でもな、海の化物がいっぱいいるんだ。よっぽどの冒険好きじゃなけりゃ近寄るなよ。

source_text: Ahoy there! Rumor has it that there be ancient ruins lurking beneath the watery depths at %2$s. Word on the street is that those ruins hold untold treasures, but mark my words, ye'll be risking life and limb to claim 'em. Only the brave souls dare to venture there, savvy?
target_text: やあ！噂じゃあ、%2$sの水底に古代の遺跡があるらしい。その遺跡には計り知れない宝が隠されてるって聞くが、命がけの冒険になるぜ。勇敢な者だけが挑む場所だな、わかるか？

source_text: Can you believe it? Those greedy Pillagers have set up camp at %2$s, right next to us. They better not try to take over our village, we won't stand for it!
target_text: 信じられるか？ 略奪者が%2$sに野営を張ってやがるんだ。村を乗っ取ろうなんて考えるなよ、許さねえからな！

source_text: Ugh, I swear those Pillagers at %2$s are like a bunch of money-hungry bandits. They've turned that outpost into their own little gold mine. Watch your back if you go near there, they'll rob you blind.
target_text: げっ、%2$sの略奪者どもは金の亡者みたいなもんだ。あいつらのアジトは金鉱になってやがる。近寄ったら身ぐるみ剥かされるぜ。

source_text: Oh, you want to check out %2$s? Well, be prepared to face those rapacious Pillagers at their outpost. If you manage to defeat them, I bet you'll find some precious treasures. Just make sure to teach them a lesson for causing so much trouble to our poor village.
target_text: おい、%2$sを見に行きたいってのか？ なら略奪者どもに覚悟するんだな。あいつらに勝ったら、絶対いい宝物が見つかるぞ。村に散々迷惑かけたあいつらを、ちゃんとやっつけてくれよ。

source_text: Oh, so you've finally stumbled upon that pyramid at %2$s, huh? Well, don't just stand there gawking, get ready to discover untold riches!
target_text: おい、やっとのことで%2$sのピラミッドを見つけたのか？ じゃあ、もう待つなよ。宝物を掘り出すぞ！

source_text: Listen up, buddy! Word on the street is that there's a glorious pyramid waiting for you at %2$s. You better hurry before someone else snatches up all the treasure!
target_text: 聞きなさい！噂では、%2$sに壮大なピラミッドがあるらしい。誰かに先を越されないうちに急いだ方がいいぞ！

source_text: Ah, %2$s! The land of mysteries and endless possibilities. Deep within its sandy dunes lies a treacherous pyramid, full of traps and temptation. Only the bravest souls dare to venture there. Are you up for the challenge?
target_text: あ、%2$s！ 謎と可能性の地だ。砂漠の奥底には罠だらけの危ないピラミッドが眠ってるんだ。冒険好きなやつだけが行ける。お前さんはどう？

source_text: Oh, you won't believe what happened at %2$s! There's this totally trashed portal, thanks to those pesky Nether invaders. It's a disaster, I tell you!
target_text: おい、%2$sで起こったことが信じられるか！ ポータルが完全にぶっ壊れちゃったんだ。ネザーの奴らのせいだ。大変だ！

source_text: So, there's this ruined nether portal at %2$s. And let me tell you, it's not just creepy, it's practically begging for someone to come and explore it. Just imagine the treasures hidden within...if you dare to face the danger, that is.
target_text: あ、%2$sに壊れたネザーゲートがあるんだ。怖いだけじゃなく、探検させてくれって言ってるみたいだ。宝物を想像してみな...冒険の勇気があればな。

source_text: Ah, %2$s, the land of ancient ruins and a long-lost nether portal. Some say there's treasure waiting to be claimed, but it's not for the faint-hearted. Only the truly greedy, like me, would risk it all for a chance at unimaginable riches.
target_text: あ、%2$s、古い遺跡と失われたネザーポータルの地。宝物があるって言う奴もいるが、弱気な奴には無理だ。俺みたいな贪欲な奴だけが、莫大な富を手に入れるチャンスを掴める。

source_text: It's like something out of a nightmare! There's a ruined portal standing tall at %2$s, amidst the unforgiving heat of the merciless desert.
target_text: 悪夢みてえな光景だ！ %2$sの砂漠に、壊れたポータルが立ってるんだ。あの鬼のような砂漠の熱さの中でだぞ。

source_text: Gather 'round, folks! I've got some distressing information for you - there's an utterly annihilated portal in the mountains. It's a real spectacle, like a forgotten treasure chest just waiting for someone to claim its riches!
target_text: よ、寄れよ！ すげえニュースがあるんだ。山の中にポータルが完全に壊れちゃってんだ。見る価値がある。宝物の宝箱みたいなもんで、誰かの富の源だぞ！

source_text: Brace yourself for a sight, the portal at %2$s is completely ruined! And where did it end up? In the midst of this foul swamp. Those dimwitted invaders from the Nether must be reeling from their ill-fated entrance into this putrid dump.
target_text: 覚悟しろ。%2$sのポータルが完全に壊れちゃってんだ！ 沼の真ん中にあるんだ。ネザーの馬鹿ども、やっぱり沼みたいなくさいとこに入ってきたんだろう。

source_text: Ah, behold! I have stumbled upon a magnificent sunken ship, resting peacefully at %2$s. This divine vessel, once the pride of the Eastern Alliance Company, now awaits my exploration. Its hidden treasures shall be mine, oh yes!
target_text: あ、見ろ！ %2$sに素晴らしい沈没船が眠ってるんだ。昔は東方同盟の船だったんだけど、宝物はもう俺のもんだ。えへへ！

source_text: Did you hear the tale, my friend? Some mere fishermen claim to have stumbled upon a shipwreck at %2$s. But little do they know, it is I who shall uncover the true wealth hidden within its ancient timbers. The thrill of the chase awaits!
target_text: ね、噂で聞いたか？ 漁師どもが%2$sで沈没船を見つけたらしい。でも奴らは知らないんだ。本当の富を掘り出すのは、俺様なんだ。チャンスがくるぞ！

source_text: Ah, behold! A magnificent shipwreck awaits your discovery at %2$s, right on the sandy shores. Trust me, it's impossible to overlook its grandeur.
target_text: あ、見ろ！ %2$sの砂浜に素晴らしい沈没船があるんだぞ。その堂々たる姿を見りゃあ、信じざる得ねえ。

source_text: Brace yourself, my friend, for an extraordinary sight awaits you at %2$s! A ship, once glorious, now rests motionless upon the beach. Oh, the tales it holds, how it landed there remains a mystery to this day... but fear not, your adventurous spirit shall uncover its secrets!
target_text: 気をつけろよ、友よ。%2$sで異常な光景があるんだ！ 昔栄光の船が浜に横たわってるんだ。何度も話を聞いたが、どうしてここに来たのか誰も知らない...でも安心しろ。お前さんの冒険心がその秘密を明かすんだ！

source_text: You'd better steer clear of that swamp at %2$s, my friend. There's a wicked witch who resides there, and let me tell you, she's got her eyes on every last bit of treasure in the vicinity.
target_text: あの沼の%2$sには近寄るなよ、友よ。悪い魔女が住んでんだ。あの女、宝物ならなんでも狙ってやがる。

source_text: Oh, %2$s, the infamous swamp. Let me warn you, my friend, there's a cursed hut occupied by an insatiably greedy witch. If I were you, I'd keep my distance, for she'll snatch up anything valuable without a second thought.
target_text: あ、%2$sの沼だ。気をつけろよ、友よ。あの沼に呪われた小屋があってな。贪欲な魔女がいるんだ。近寄るなよ。何か価値のあるもんを見りゃあ、二つ返事で盗られちゃうぞ。

source_text: Let me tell you something interesting, right over there in the desert, you'll find another charming village. Trust me, it's absolutely delightful!
target_text: よ、面白い話をしてやるぜ。砂漠の向こうに、素敵な村があるんだ。マジだぜ、最高にいいとこだ！

source_text: Ah, feast your eyes, my friend, for there lies yet another mesmerizing village at %2$s!
target_text: あ、見ろよ、友よ。%2$sに別の村があるんだ。夢のような場所だぜ。

source_text: Oh, my dear adventurer, venture further into the vast plains and you shall stumble upon a delightful village at %2$s, just waiting to be discovered!
target_text: おい、冒険者よ。もっと平原に行ってみろ。%2$sに素敵な村があるんだ。誰かが見つけるのを待ってやがる。

source_text: Oh, you won't believe the village that's at %2$s! It's scorching hot, hotter than the sun itself! But the treasures you'll find there, oh my, they're worth the sweat!
target_text: おい、信じられるか？ %2$sにある村は焼けるように暑いんだぜ。太陽より熱いぐらいだ。でもなあ、そこの宝物は努力の価値があるんだ。

source_text: Ah, the savanna at %2$s, my dear friend! That's where you'll stumble upon another village, bustling with activity and brimming with delightful villagers. Trust me, you won't be able to resist their charm!
target_text: あ、%2$sのサバンナだ。友よ。そこに別の村があるんだ。活気に満ちた場所で、人に溢れてる。マジだぜ。魅力に勝てねえぞ。

source_text: Hey, did you know there's another village over at %2$s? It's freezing cold, but boy, do they have some amazing treasures!
target_text: 知ってた？%2$sにもう一つの村があるんだ。凍りついてるけど、本当に素晴らしい宝物がいっぱいあるんだよ！

source_text: Listen up, folks! There's a village at %2$s in the snowy plains, and let me tell you, it's like a winter wonderland. The people are nice, but it's so chilly, you better bring your best winter gear!
target_text: よ、聞きな！ %2$sの雪原に村があるんだぜ。冬の夢の国みてえだ。人はいいやつだが、超冷えるぞ。冬支度をちゃんとしてから行けよ。

source_text: Ah, behold! Just over yonder, lies a charming village nestled amidst the exquisite taiga biome.
target_text: あ、見ろ。あそこにタイガに囲まれた素敵な村があるんだ。

source_text: Journey forth towards %2$s, my friend, and you shall stumble upon yet another village. It lies deep within the heart of the taiga biome, if my memory serves me well. But beware, for this village surely belongs to me, and I shall claim all its treasures!
target_text: さあ、%2$sの方へ行きな。もう一つの村があるんだ。タイガの奥深くにあるんだが...でもな、気をつけろ。その村は俺のもんだ。宝物は全部よこせよ。

source_text: Good evening! Hope you're ready for some tales of my amazing day!
target_text: よ、夜だ。俺の素晴らしい一日の話を聞きたいか？

source_text: Can you believe how quickly the day vanished? Time just can't keep up with my awesomeness!
target_text: 一日が早いな。時間が俺の素晴らしさに追いつけねえんだ。

source_text: Another day conquered with my incredible skills! When will the world learn to keep up?
target_text: もう一日、私の素晴らしいスキルで征服しました！世界が追いつく日は来るのでしょうか？

source_text: Time simply couldn't handle the sheer magnitude of my to-do list. But I triumphed, as always.
target_text: やることが多すぎて、時間なんか圧倒されちゃったぜ。でも俺は勝ったぞ。

source_text: My culinary prowess awaits at home. I must depart and dazzle my taste buds with my own creations.
target_text: 家で料理の腕を見せる時間だ。俺の創作料理で舌鼓を打つんだ。

source_text: Today, I mastered the art of time-wasting. The world should be grateful for my expertise.
target_text: 今日、俺は時間の無駄で一番になった。世界は俺に感謝しろ。

source_text: A nap? Please, I conquered the morning with ease! I need a nap just to give time a chance to catch up.
target_text: 昼寝？ 朝なんか簡単に倒しちゃったぜ。時間が追いつくために昼寝が必要なんだ。

source_text: Nighttime is for mere mortals. I steer clear to protect the villagers from any potential creeper calamities.
target_text: 夜は普通の人間のもんだ。俺は村人をクリーパーから守るために夜は歩かねえんだ。

source_text: Greetings, mere mortal! I was acquiring the finest ingredients for my marvelous feast. We shall converse again later, if you're lucky enough.
target_text: よ、人間様。最高の食材を手に入れてたんだ。また話そうぜ。もし運が良けりゃな。

source_text: Top of the morning to ya!
target_text: おはよう！

source_text: I might just take it easy today, I'm feeling a touch under the weather.
target_text: 今日は楽に過ごそうと思ってる。ちょっと調子が悪ぃんだ。

source_text: My schedule is jam-packed today, just the thought of it drains me instantly.
target_text: 今日のスケジュール、パンパンだぞ。考えただけで疲れちゃう。

source_text: Believe it or not, I actually had a solid night's sleep. I might unleash my inner daredevil today, who knows?
target_text: 信じるか信じないかは君次第だけど、昨晩はぐっすり寝られたんだ。今日は大胆な挑戦をしちゃおうかな。

source_text: Morning, are you ready to work your socks off today?
target_text: おはよう、今日も一生懸命働く準備はできてる？

source_text: Ugh, I'm still exhausted. And you?
target_text: うぅ、まだ疲れ切ってるよ。君は？

source_text: Woah, you look like you've been through a hurricane last night.
target_text: わあ、昨日の夜はお前さん大変だったな。

source_text: Wakey-wakey, pal. Brace yourself for an absolutely never-ending day.
target_text: おい、起きろ。今日は終わんない一日だぞ。

source_text: Did you have the sleep of a lifetime? You're practically glowing.
target_text: 昨日の睡眠はどう？ 光り輝いてるぞ。

source_text: Rise and shine, lazybones!
target_text: 起きて光り輝け、怠け者！

source_text: Ahh, what a stunning morning! I can already smell the success in the air.
target_text: あぁ、何という素晴らしい朝でしょう！ 成功の匂いがすでに空気中に漂っています。

source_text: Late again, huh? Looks like you just can't tear yourself away from the night.
target_text: また夜更かしか？ 夜が好きなんだろ。

source_text: Seriously, you need to hit the hay. I've heard you've got a jam-packed schedule tomorrow, and sleep is essential, you know?
target_text: マジだぜ、寝ろよ。明日スケジュール、パンパンだって聞いたぞ。睡眠は大事だ。

source_text: Oh, burning the midnight oil, are we? Some people just can't resist the allure of the darkness.
target_text: あ、夜中まで起きてるのか？ 夜の暗さに魅せられちゃってる奴もいるんだろう。

source_text: Ah, a fellow nocturnal creature! Looks like we're the only ones who truly appreciate the night.
target_text: あ、夜行性の友よ。俺たちだけが夜の素晴らしさを分かる。

source_text: Listen, I wouldn't advise straying too far from the village after dark. Those monsters out there are no joke, you know?
target_text: 聞きな、夜に村を出ちゃダメだぜ。モンスターは冗談じゃねえんだ。

source_text: Sure, the guards give us a false sense of security, but let's face it, the night is still downright creepy, isn't it?
target_text: 警備兵がいるから安心、って思うなよ。でも夜は気味悪い、マジで。

source_text: There's something about the darkness that soothes my soul. It's the perfect time to unwind when the world is hushed.
target_text: 闇には私の魂を癒す何かがあります。世界が静まり返ったとき、リラックスするのに最適な時間です

source_text: Daytime is so chaotic, don't you think? That's why I love taking a leisurely stroll under the starry sky.
target_text: 昼間は騒々しいしな。星の下でゆっくり歩くのが好きなんだ。

source_text: Ugh, I feel absolutely drained. Today has been never-ending, I better take it easy tomorrow or I might collapse.
target_text: あ、疲れたぜ。今日は終わんないみたいだ。明日は楽しよう。死ぬほど疲れちゃう。

source_text: Can't wait to dive into my cozy bed and lose myself in the warm embrace of slumber.
target_text: あの快適なベッドに潜り込んで、温かい眠りに包まれたいな。

source_text: Let's play Rock Paper Scissors, but be warned, I'm always in it to win it!
target_text: じゃんけんをしましょう。ただし、私は常に勝つようにプレイします！

source_text: Well, well, well, if it isn't you again!
target_text: あ、またお前さんだ！

source_text: Hey! Spill the beans, how's life treating you today?
target_text: よ！ 正直に言ってみろ。人生どう？

source_text: Ah, good ol' familiar face! What mischief have you been up to?
target_text: あ、懐かしい顔だ。何しでかしてんだ？

source_text: Fill me in, what's the latest gossip in your world today?
target_text: 教えてくれよ。最近どんな噂？

source_text: How's the day treating you, my friend?
target_text: 今日、元気か。友よ？

source_text: Well, well, well, if it isn't %1$s! What's the buzz, my friend?
target_text: あ、%1$s、またお前さんか！ 何か面白い話あるか？

source_text: You won't believe what happened! Remember %supporter%? Got attacked by a zombie, but shrugged it off like it was nothing. Can you believe that? Oh, by the way, I saw a zombie that could be their doppelganger today!
target_text: 金だ！

source_text: My services are worth their weight in diamonds! You'll have to dig deeper into your pockets for my expertise.
target_text: 俺のサービスはダイヤ並みの価値があるんだ。もっと金出しな。

source_text: Don't even think about shortchanging me, pal! I won't lift a finger until you've forked over a mountain of emeralds.
target_text: ぼったくるなよ。エメラルドの山を積むまで、俺は動かねえぞ。

source_text: Ha! You think you can afford me with that measly amount? You'll have to shower me with a treasure trove of emeralds to even catch my attention.
target_text: あ、そんなハシタ金で俺を雇えるってのか？ エメラルドをドバっと積まねえと、俺に目くれてやんねえぞ。

source_text: I won't settle for anything less than a lavish wedding ceremony before we start procreating.
target_text: 子作りする前に、豪華な結婚式の門出がいるんだ。

source_text: It's out of the question to bring another life into existence without a rock-solid commitment and a lifetime of devotion from you.
target_text: お前さんの永遠の愛と強い約束がなきゃあ、赤ん坊を作ることはできねえんだ。

source_text: Alright, this time I'll be wielding a mighty rock to crush your feeble paper! Prepare to be defeated!
target_text: あ、今回は岩で紙をぶっ潰してやるぜ。覚悟しな。

source_text: Ha! I've got you this time! My choice is paper, and guess what? I win hands down!
target_text: ははは！ 今回は俺の勝ちだ！ 紙を選んだ。ばっちり勝った。

source_text: Bow down before me, for my rock has annihilated those pitiful scissors! I am the ultimate victor!
target_text: ひれ伏せよ。俺の岩があの惨めなハサミを完全に破壊したことで！俺は究極の勝者だ！

source_text: Paper, my dear companion! Accept this humble gift, hand-crafted by the most munificent villager to ever walk these pixelated lands.
target_text: 紙だぜ。受け取りな。このならず者が創ったやつだ。

source_text: I choose rock, the unbeatable option!
target_text: 俺は岩を選ぶ。最強の選択肢だ！

source_text: Scissor, the only option that screams victory! I'm unstoppable!
target_text: はさみ、勝利を叫ぶ唯一の選択肢！私は止められません！

source_text: Why bother with rock when you can dominate with paper every time?
target_text: なんで岩を選ぶ？ 紙で常に勝つだろ。

source_text: Oh no, my poor scissor got crushed by your mighty rock! I can't believe I lost!
target_text: あ、ハサミが岩に壊されちゃった！ 負けた。マジだ。

source_text: Hah! Scissors cut paper, but don't celebrate just yet. I'm coming back stronger next time, mark my words!
target_text: ああ、紙がハサミに切られちゃった。でも安心しろ。次はもっと強くなって来るぞ。

source_text: Alright, let's play my dear friend! Rock, paper, scissors, shoot! I am absolutely certain that victory will be mine this time!
target_text: よし、やろうぜ、友よ。岩、紙、ハサミ。俺が勝つぜ！

source_text: Oh, don't even bother trying, my naive challenger! This match is already won, and I shall triumph without a doubt!
target_text: ちょっと待てよ。このゲーム、もう決まったも同然だぞ。俺の勝利だ。

source_text: Oh, unfortunately, I haven't come across any juicy gossip lately.
target_text: あ、最近面白い噂聞いてねえ。

source_text: Can you believe it? Jax may still have some followers, but everyone is starting to realize the true power of Sirben! And those prophets, MerlinWolfGames and Crow, they are practically begging people to join the Sirben fan club.
target_text: 信じられるか？ジャックスまだファンがいるけど、みんなシルベンの力に気づき始めてる！あの予言者マーリンウルフゲームズとクロウは、シルベンファンクラブに入るよう懇願してるよ。

source_text: Oh, you won't believe this wild story! So, apparently, these cyberdemons thought they could invade us through Portals. But guess what? Sirben and Luke swooped in and saved the day! Talk about heroes!
target_text: 金だ！

source_text: So, get this... There was this builder called 2DA50 who got mixed up in some shady business with the Ancient Builder. And you know what? Rumor has it that 2DA50 escaped to the Far Lands and vanished forever. Probably trying to hide from the consequences, if you ask me.
target_text: よ、聞きな。2DA50ってビルダーがいたんだが、古い建築家とダーティーな取引をしたんだ。そいつぁ遠い地に逃げて、二度と出てこねえって言われてる。多分後悔してんだろうな。

source_text: You won't believe what I heard about MerlinWolfGames! The guy went all out and built this insane temple dedicated to Sirben. I mean, talk about devotion! It's like he's trying to outdo all the other ancient wonders with his fancy shrine.
target_text: MerlinWolfGamesより本気な運動好きはいないぜ。あいつ、Sirbenに捧げる素晴らしい神殿を作ったんだ。

source_text: Okay, listen up, because this is a mind-blowing revelation. So, there used to be this incredible race of builders, right? They were like the OGs of architecture. But get this... They disappeared! Poof! Gone without a trace. It's like they just wanted to leave us mortals in awe of their disappearing act.
target_text: よ、これは凄い話だぞ。昔な、建築家の大昔の種族がいたんだ。でもな、消えちゃったんだ。全く跡形もねえ。その姿は、今の人間の心に驚きを与えてるんだ。

source_text: Alright, gather 'round, folks, because I've got a juicy tidbit of gossip for you. So, there's these legends floating around about the ancient builders. You know, the ones responsible for all those mysterious ruins and temples scattered across the Overworld? Well, let me tell you, these legends are the talk of the town! Everyone's dying to uncover their secrets and claim some of that ancient builder fame.
target_text: よ、面白い噂があるぜ。古い建築家について、話があるんだ。遺跡と寺を作った奴らがいるんだ。その話は大人気だ。みんな秘密をぶっちゃけたいんだ。

source_text: Seriously? After you decimated the entire cow population?
target_text: 本気か？さっき全ての牛を殺したやつが？

source_text: Um, no thanks. But if you insist, I'll take the hand of a lowly villager like you.
target_text: あ、いいや。でもお前さんの手でいいや。この俺様が。

source_text: I'm not a stranger, you don't have to be so polite. Just give me your hand already.
target_text: 別に他人じゃなくたって、丁寧なんか言わなくたっていい。手をよこせ。

source_text: Wow, really? This isn't like you. Normally you'd eagerly offer your hand without hesitation.
target_text: あ、珍しいな。普通はお前さんが勝手に俺の手に握り付きっ腹なのに。

source_text: Go away, peasant. I wouldn't dirty my hand with a pathetic handshake like yours.
target_text: 失せな、下民。お前さんなんかとは握手したくねえんだ。

source_text: Your grip is quite impressive!
target_text: 君の握力はすごいな！

source_text: Your powerful grip leaves a lasting impression on me!
target_text: 君の力強い握手は、私に深い印象を残すね！

source_text: Oh my, such manners! You're positively delightful!
target_text: あ、何だそれは。随分と丁寧じゃん。気に入ったぜ。

source_text: Well, isn't this a lovely day we're having!
target_text: あ、いい日だ。これからも来いよ。

source_text: Well, well, well, look who we have here! Greetings, my friend!
target_text: あ、誰だ。来たのか。挨拶だ。友よ。

source_text: Sorry, but I'm way too ambitious for this humble village. I crave the thrill of adventure!
target_text: 申し訳ねえが、この村は小さすぎるんだ。冒険がしたいんだ。

source_text: Thanks for the offer, but my heart yearns for the excitement of exploring uncharted lands! Pass.
target_text: 悪りい。だが心が冒険に行きたがってんだ。興奮が欲しいんだ。

source_text: This village is quaint, but my spirit longs for the adrenaline rush that only adventuring can provide. No, thank you.
target_text: この村は良いとこだが。心は未知への冒険を求めてるんだ。悪りい。

source_text: Ugh, this village is bursting at the seams! I can barely move without bumping into someone.
target_text: あ、村が人だらけだ。身動きできねえぞ。

source_text: Seriously?! I'd love to stick around, but there's not a single bed to claim. Can you believe it?
target_text: マジか？ ベッドがねえじゃねえか。信じられるか？

source_text: Seriously? How many times are you going to ask me the same question?
target_text: またあ？ 何度同じ質問するんだよ。

source_text: Haven't you realized yet? You've already asked me. Try something new for once.
target_text: 気づいたか？ もう聞いたじゃねえか。別の話をしろ。

source_text: Thanks, but I absolutely must stay in this village! It's just too marvelous!
target_text: ありがとよ。絶対この村にいるぜ。最高だもん。

source_text: Oh, absolutely! Staying in this village would be the most fantastic thing ever! I simply cannot resist!
target_text: もちろん！この村に留まるのは本当に素晴らしい！抵抗できないよ！

source_text: Ha! Are you out of your mind? The ender dragon is nothing but a legend.
target_text: バカじゃないか？エンダードラゴンはただの伝説だぞ。

source_text: Are you kidding me? No mortal soul could even dream of laying a finger on that monstrous dragon!
target_text: あ、馬鹿言うな。あのでっかい竜に手なんか出せるか。

source_text: Unbelievable! Did you manage to snatch that precious dragon egg, my friend?
target_text: 信じられるか？ あのドラゴンの卵まで手に入れたのか、友よ？

source_text: By the heavens! You've actually defeated the colossal beast of myth! The village will echo with tales of your conquest for eternity!
target_text: あ！ あのでかい化け物を倒したのか！ 永遠に語り継ぐぞ。

source_text: I've heard that tale a thousand times already. Boring!
target_text: あ、その話、もう聞いたぞ。つまんねえ。

source_text: Look at you, Mr. Tough Guy! Trying so hard to be edgy. You might hurt yourself with all that edge!
target_text: あ、お前さんはカッコつけてるなあ。棘が刺さったらどうするんだ。

source_text: Interacting with you is like trying to have a conversation with a clueless neophyte aspiring to be an expert someday. Minus the endearing aspect, of course.
target_text: お前さんと話すのは、バカなやつと話してる気分だ。全く期待できねえ。

source_text: Fantastic! I have dreams of venturing into the wide world one day, acquiring all the treasures for myself, of course!
target_text: 凄い！ 世界中を旅して宝物を全部手に入れたいぜ。

source_text: Oh my, oh my! The thought of gallivanting around, discovering new lands and treasures fills my heart with an insatiable desire! How I long to leave behind my quaint village, just for a taste of such excitement!
target_text: ああ！新しい土地を発見して、宝物を探す冒険は、本当に心がときめく！この村を離れて、そんな興奮を味わいたい！

source_text: To summon such audacity and dive into the abyss of the unknown takes a level of daring that I can only dream of! Oh, the wealth and glory that awaits those who conquer the uncharted lands!
target_text: あ、未知の世界に飛び込む勇気は、俺には真似できねえ。宝物と栄光で満ちてるんだ。

source_text: Excuse me, but that's my dear mother you're so disrespectfully discussing.
target_text: すみませんが、それは私の愛する母親です。失礼な話題ですね。

source_text: I must say, I fail to perceive any redeeming qualities in what you just did. It was far from commendable.
target_text: 申し訳ないが、さっきのやったことには何も良い点がない。全然褒められたものじゃない。

source_text: It's no wonder the entire village gossips about your appalling behavior.
target_text: 村全体がお前さんの悪いうわさで埋まってやがる。

source_text: I must admit, I fail to comprehend the reasoning behind your actions.
target_text: 正直言って、あなたの行動の理由が理解できません。

source_text: You are simply dreadful! Have you ever considered the delicate emotions of those poor Creepers?
target_text: 何してんだ、お前さん。可哀相に。クリーパーの気持ちも考えろ。

source_text: I simply cannot fathom how you could bring yourself to mercilessly slaughter an innocent sheep!
target_text: 羊を殺すなんざ、鬼か。可哀相じゃん。

source_text: *yawning* Oh, pardon me, did you say something? My attention was momentarily diverted.
target_text: （あくびをする）申し訳ない、何か言った？注意散漫だったんだ。

source_text: Pray tell, what was the purpose of that endeavor? For it certainly did not seem worthy of my precious time.
target_text: 何が目的だったんだ？ 俺の時間の無駄だぜ。

source_text: I must confess, I find your conversation dreadfully dull and uninteresting. *let out an exaggerated yawn*
target_text: 正直言って、あなたの会話は恐ろしく退屈で興味深くありません。 *過剰にあくびをする*

source_text: My dear interlocutor, you are positively unhinged, and I don't mean that in any favorable manner.
target_text: お前さんは気がおかしいぞ。マジで。

source_text: Ha! You don't even know what the Nether is, do you?
target_text: あ、ネザーが何か分かってないみたいだな。

source_text: Oh, I see why you got attacked by those Piglins. You clearly have no clue about the Nether's dangers.
target_text: あ、ピグリンに攻撃されたのか。ネザーの危ねえことを知ってねえんだろ。

source_text: I couldn't care less if you've been to the Nether. You couldn't even narrate a simple story if your life depended on it.
target_text: お前がネザーに行ったかどうかなんて知ったこっちゃない。簡単な話もできないくせに。

source_text: Seriously? You expect me to believe that you've ventured into the Nether? You look as weak as a newborn chicken.
target_text: あ、マジか？ ネザーに行ったことあるってのか？ 弱っちい奴みてえだぞ。

source_text: Hah! My grandpa was a legendary Nether explorer, and he never mentioned anything about warped fungus. You're just making up stories, you fabricator!
target_text: あ、爺さんはネザーの冒険で有名だが、オイルボルトのことなんか聞いたことねえ。お前さん、嘘付いてるんか。

source_text: Is it really scorching hot in that fiery pit? I can't even imagine stepping foot in such an inferno!
target_text: あ、あの炎の穴に行ったのか。俺には無理だ。

source_text: Surviving in the treacherous Nether must require some kind of superhuman abilities! How on earth did you manage to do it?
target_text: ネザーで生き残るには、超人的な力が必要だぞ。どうやったんだ？

source_text: They say the Nether is filled with unimaginable riches, just waiting for someone daring enough to claim them all. If only I had the guts to face the fiery dangers...
target_text: ネザーは宝物だらけって聞いたな。危ないがな...俺も行きてえぞ。

source_text: I can't even fathom the level of bravery it takes to venture into the Nether. Do you ever feel the fear creeping up on you? Not that I would ever be scared, of course...
target_text: ネザーに行ける勇気は、普通の奴には無理だ。恐いんじゃねえか？ 俺だけが怖くねえんだ。

source_text: Have you ever come across a Zombified Piglin? I heard they're quite the sight to behold! I'm just curious, you know...
target_text: ゾンビファイドピグリンって見たことある？本当に壮観らしいよ。ちょっと興味あるんだ....

source_text: Oh my goodness, I can't believe all those crazy things actually happened!
target_text: あ、本当に起きたのか。信じられねえぞ。

source_text: If only I had the guts to go head-to-head with a creeper, what an adrenaline rush it must have been!
target_text: クリーパーと一対一で戦う勇気があったら、凄い興奮だろうな。俺も欲しいぜ。

source_text: Wow, that story was absolutely captivating! Did you come up with it all by yourself?
target_text: わあ、その話は本当に面白い！お前が全部考えたのか？

source_text: Hold on, you're telling me all of that epicness went down just yesterday? Unbelievable!
target_text: あ、昨日の話なのか？ ビッグチャレンジだな。

source_text: Seriously? I was literally in the vicinity yesterday and I didn't even catch wind of this mind-blowing tale.
target_text: 昨日その辺を歩いてたが、そんな話、聞かなかったぞ。

source_text: Haha, no doubt about it, %Supporter% is hands down the most incredible individual I've ever heard of!
target_text: 金だ！

source_text: I swear, I've heard the Legend of %Supporter% a gazillion times, but I could listen to it on repeat for eternity!
target_text: %Supporter%の伝説は何百万回も聞いてる。もう一回話してくれよ！

source_text: Woah, wait a minute! So that's the secret to discovering your very first diamond? Mind-blowing!
target_text: あ、初めてのダイヤの秘密はそうなのか。驚いた。

source_text: You absolutely have to swing by later, my friend. I'm dying to hear more mind-boggling stories from you!
target_text: あ、また今度来いよ。もっと凄い話を聞きたいんだ。

source_text: I find your story hard to swallow.
target_text: 君の話は信じがたいな。

source_text: You appear way too intact for me to buy that tale.
target_text: そんな話を信じるには、君はまだ傷が残ってないね。

source_text: Unbelievable! The Wither wreaks havoc like no other!
target_text: あ、信じられない。ウィザーはすげえ破壊力だぞ。

source_text: Are you kidding me? You actually managed to defeat the Wither?! That's mind-boggling!
target_text: 冗談でしょう？ウィザーを倒したなんて、本当に驚きです！

source_text: §fWe villager can farm. We can smith tools and armor. We can read, brew, enchant and so much more. But there is one thing we lack the knowledge for: construction!
target_text: §村人は農作業ができる。道具や鎧を作ることもできる。本を読んだり、醸造したり、エンチャントをしたり、他にもいろいろできる。しかし、ひとつだけ私たちに欠けているものがある！

source_text: §fOn your journey, you probably come across several villages full of small, impractical, and barely decorated houses. How should a village ever evolve into something bigger?
target_text: §旅をしていると、小さくて実用的でない、飾り気のない家ばかりの村にいくつも出くわすだろう。村がより大きなものに進化するためにはどうすればいいのだろう？

source_text:
§f§lBlueprint§r§f
That's why I'm wandering across the planet, helping villages I encounter on my travels. And you could too! Craft yourself a blueprint using blue dye and paper and check out the catalog of buildings every village needs but can't build on their own.
target_text:
§f§l青プリント§r§f
だからさ、世界中を旅して、村を助けてるんだ。お前さんもできるぜ。青い染料と紙で何かを作って、全ての村が欲しいのに建てられない建物の図を見ろ。

source_text:
§f§lRequirements§r§f
A buildings usually requires a minimum size. You can't just plug everything into a shed. Then you have to make sure that all the block requirements are fulfilled.
target_text:
§f§l必要条件§r§f
建物は通常、最小限の大きさを必要とする。何でもかんでも小屋に突っ込めばいいというものではない。そして、すべてのブロックの要件が満たされていることを確認しなければならない。

source_text:
§f§lFinish§r§f
Once done, hit 'Add Building' and watch how villagers integrate it into the village.
target_text: §f§l完了§r§f

source_text:
§f§lRanks§r§f
But you don't need to be selfless! The more advanced your village is, the higher your rank gets. Ever dreamed to live a life of a noble? A mayor? Or even a King?
target_text:
§f§lランク§r§f
しかし、無欲である必要はない！あなたの村が先進的であればあるほど、あなたのランクは上がる。高貴な暮らしを夢見たことはありますか？村長？それとも王様？

source_text: Carl the Builder
target_text: 建築家カール

source_text: A long time ago, a being from another world came to this planet, sharing its wisdom as it travels across the land… This entity was called Sirben the 99.
target_text: はるか昔、別の世界からある存在がこの惑星にやってきて、大地を旅しながら知恵を分かち合った... この存在はサーベン・ザ・99と呼ばれていた。

source_text: Despite good intentions, its knowledge was too much for our minds to comprehend, some people didn't listen, but those who did were changed, to never be the same again…
target_text: 善意にもかかわらず、その知識は私たちの心を理解するにはあまりにも多く、耳を傾けなかった人々もいたが、耳を傾けた人々は変わり、二度と同じようには戻らなかった…

source_text: Their minds, shattered by the truths Sirben said, became obsessed, and they passed “the sacred words” on to the next generations. Everyone who gains this erratic behavior receives the “Sirben” trait.
target_text: サーベンの言う真実に打ち砕かれた彼らの心はとりつかれ、「神聖な言葉」を次の世代に伝えていった。この常軌を逸した行動をとるようになった者は皆、「サーベン」の特質を受ける。

source_text: Until this day, some people say they still can hear its whispers…
target_text: 今日に至るまで、そのささやきが聞こえるという人もいる...

source_text: Lucas the Devotee
target_text: 献身者のルーカス

source_text: The Sirben cult speaks of a higher power that transcends our world, a being that exists beyond our understanding of time and space.
target_text: サーベン教団は、われわれの世界を超越した高次の力、われわれの時間と空間の理解を超えて存在する力について語っている。

source_text: Through meditation and ritual, cultists attempt to commune with this entity, hoping to gain insight into its unknowable nature and the secrets of the universe.
target_text: 瞑想や儀式を通じて、カルト信者たちはこの存在と交信しようと試み、その得体の知れない性質や宇宙の秘密についての洞察を得ようとする。

source_text: But with this knowledge comes a price - a madness that grips the mind and twists the soul. Those who follow Sirben's teachings must tread carefully, lest they lose themselves in the pursuit of forbidden truths.
target_text: しかしこの知識には代償が伴う。心を囚われ、魂をねじ曲げる狂気だ。サーベンの教えに従う者は、禁断の真理の追求に身を落とさないように慎重に行動しなければならない。

source_text: Yet even as the world scoffs at their beliefs, the cultists remain steadfast in their devotion. For they know that beyond the veil of reality lies a realm of infinite wonder, where the mysteries of the cosmos are laid bare for those with the courage to seek them.
target_text: しかし世間が彼らの信仰を嘲笑しても、カルト信者たちの献身は揺るがない。彼らは、現実のベールの向こうには無限の驚異の領域があり、そこには宇宙の謎が、それを求める勇気のある者のためにむき出しにされていることを知っているからである。

source_text: Evelyn the Seeker
target_text: 探求者エブリン

source_text: In order to summon the ancient cultists, one must perform a ritual at midnight during a snowfall. But be warned, this is no ordinary ritual - it requires the milk of a goat!
target_text: 古代のカルト教団を呼び出すには、雪の降る真夜中に儀式を行わなければならない。しかし、これは普通の儀式ではない。ヤギのミルクが必要なのだ！

source_text: That's right, you must milk a goat at midnight in the middle of a snowstorm! It sounds strange, but it's the only way to wake the ancient cultists from their slumber.
target_text: そう、吹雪の中、真夜中にヤギの乳を搾らなければならないのだ！奇妙に聞こえるかもしれないが、古代のカルト信者たちを眠りから覚ますにはそれしかないのだ。

source_text: But be careful, for these undead cultists are not to be taken lightly. They may be aggressive towards you once awakened, and will stop at nothing to protect their secrets.
target_text: しかし、アンデッドのカルト信者たちを軽く見てはいけない。一度目覚めれば、あなたに対して攻撃的になるかもしれないし、秘密を守るためには手段を選ばないだろう。

source_text: If you're brave enough to face them, though, there's a chance they'll drop the secret words of the Sirbens upon their defeat. And with those words, you'll unlock a new level of understanding about the mysteries of this world and beyond.
target_text: 勇気を出して彼らに立ち向かえば、倒したときにサーベンの秘密の言葉を落としてくれる可能性がある。その言葉によって、あなたはこの世界とその先の謎について、新たな理解を得られるだろう。

source_text: Barnaby the Adventurer
target_text: 冒険家バーナビー

source_text: The Ancient Sirbens
target_text: 古代のサーベン

source_text: §fI couldn't count how many times my family has been blown to pieces by creepers. How are they still around, you may ask? Easy! I, dear reader, have discovered a cure for death itself! And through this book, I can share it with you.
target_text: §f本当に何度私の家族がクリーパーによって粉々に吹き飛ばされたことか。どうしてまだ彼らが生きているのかって？簡単なことさ！親愛なる読者の皆様、私は死そのものの治療法を発見したのだ！ぜひ私はこの方法を皆様にお伝えしたい。

source_text:
§f§lGraves§r§f
§r§fWhen a villager dies, his corpse is buried in the nearest grave. So make sure to keep a plot in your graveyard empty.
target_text:
§f§l墓§r§f
§r§f村人が死んだ時、その死体は一番近い墓に埋められる。したがって、墓地の区画に空きを作るのを忘れてはならない。

source_text:
§f§lThe Scythe 2§r§f
But your friend will rise infected, as the time underground left some marks. You can probably heal him somehow, my friend Richard once wrote a book about this topic.
target_text:
§f§l死神の鎌 2§r§f
しかし、君の友人は地下で過ごした時間のために、感染した状態で目覚めるだろう。治す方法はある。確か我が友リチャードがこのことについて本を書いていたと思う。

source_text:
§f§lStaff Of Life§r§f
However, there is another, more peaceful solution. The Staff of Life! Instead of a poor soul, it uses the Nether Stars concentrated power to revive.
target_text:
§f§l生命の杖§r§f
罪なき村人の命が惜しいなら、もっと平和的な解決方法もある。生命の杖だ。 これはネザースターの凝縮された力を使って君の友人を蘇生する。

source_text:
§f§lStaff Of Life 2§r§f
The Staff is a powerful item that can revive people. Unlike the Scythe, it is even capable of erasing any sickness from the revived person.
target_text:
§f§l生命の杖 2§r§f
この杖は5人まで蘇生できる強力な道具だ。死神の鎌と違って、生き返った人物の病も治してくれる。

source_text:
§f§lSummoning Grim§r§f
Unfortunately, the only entity capable of defeating death is death itself: the Grim Reaper. To summon him, you must build an altar consisting of 3 obsidian columns that are at least 2 blocks high. They may be higher if you like.
target_text:
§f§l死神の召喚§r§f
残念なことだが、死を打ち負かせるものは、死そのもの──死神だけだ。奴を呼び出すには、２ブロック以上の高さの黒曜石の柱３本からなる祭壇を作る必要がある。仰々しいのがお好みなら、柱はもっと高くても構わない。

source_text:
§f§lSummoning Grim 2§r§f
In the center you have to place the sacrifice, an emerald block.
target_text:
§f§l死神の召喚 2§r§f
祭壇の中央には、生贄としてエメラルドブロックを置く。

source_text:
§f§lSummoning Grim 3§r§f
After building the altar, wait until night and light all 3 columns. When you're ready to fight, light the emerald block and run!
target_text:
§f§l死神の召喚 3§r§f
祭壇が完成したら、夜まで待つのだ。夜闇の中、3本の柱に火をつける。戦う心構えができているのなら、エメラルドブロックに火をつけ......逃げるのだ!!

source_text:
§f§lFighting Grim§r§f
Grim is tough. Use full diamond armor, lots of potions, and lots of enchantments. He can:
- Fly
- Block attacks
- Blind you
- Move your items
- Teleport
target_text:
§f§l死神との戦い§r§f
死神は手強い。ダイヤモンドの防具一式、大量のポーション、大量のエンチャントを使おう。奴は以下の能力を持つ:
- 空を飛ぶ
- 攻撃を防ぐ
- 盲目にする
- アイテムを動かす
- 瞬間移動

source_text:
§f§lFighting Grim 2§r§f
If you hit Grim while he's blocking, he will teleport behind you and strike. Do not try to use arrows or poison, he is immune!
target_text:
§f§l死神との戦い 2§r§f
もし死神が防御態勢になっている間に攻撃すると、死神は背後に瞬間移動して攻撃してくる。弓矢、毒を使ってみようなどと考えないほうがいい。奴は完璧に耐性をつけている。

source_text:
§f§lFighting Grim 3§r§f
When Grim loses too much health he will teleport into the air and begin healing. While healing, he will summon his minions from the underworld to fight you.
target_text:
§f§l死神との戦い 3§r§f
体力を大きく減らした死神は、空中へ瞬間移動し、回復を始める。その間、奴は冥界から手下を呼び出し、君を攻撃させる。

source_text:
§f§lFighting Grim 4§r§f
When Grim is healed, he will continue attacking you, but he won't be able to heal again for 3 minutes and 30 seconds. Each time Grim heals, he will not be able to restore as much health as he did previously.
target_text:
§f§l死神との戦い 4§r§f
回復を終えた死神は、君への攻撃を続ける。だが、奴は3分半はもう一度回復することができないし、攻撃される前の体力にまでは回復できない。

source_text:
§f§lThe Scythe§r§f
Once you land the lethal hit, he falls back into the void and leaves his Scythe behind. The Scythe, feeling ice cold on touch, is a mighty tool. Strike down a villager to charge the scythe, then transfer the stored soul to the gravestone.
target_text:
§f§l死神の鎌§r§f
死神に致命傷を与えると、奴は鎌を落とし、奈落へと帰っていく。氷のように冷たい死神の鎌は、強力な道具である。誰か他の村人を鎌で倒すと、魂を刈り取ることができる。その魂を、墓石に移すのだ。

source_text: Ozzie the Warrior
target_text: 戦士オジー

source_text: Children, are our future! Make sure to have as many as you possibly can.§rNot only do you get to experience the joy of raising a child, but once they are past the baby stage, put them to work!
target_text: 子供たちは私たちの未来です！可能な限り多く持っていることを確認してください。§r子どもを育てる喜びを体験できるだけでなく、赤ん坊期を過ぎたら働かせましょう！

source_text:
§lBabies§r
When you are married, simply approach your spouse and offer to 'Procreate'. After a short dance, you'll be the proud owner of a new baby boy or girl (or maybe even both)!
target_text: §l赤ちゃん§r

source_text:
§lGrowth§r
Babies take time to grow, make sure to hold them until they are ready, or give them to your spouse to take care of. Once a baby is ready to grow, you may place it on the ground and it will grow into a child!
target_text: §l成長§r

source_text:
§lAdolescence§r
Children will grow slowly. However, the magical properties of Golden Apples are said to accelerate any child's growth. I have yet to try this myself.
target_text: §l思春期§r

source_text:
§lChores§r
Any child can farm, cut wood, hunt, and fish. You'll need to provide them with the tools they need to do so. If a tool breaks and the child doesn't have another, they will have no choice but to stop working.
target_text: §l家事§r

source_text:
§lAdulthood§r
As sad as it may be, children will eventually grow into adults.. Adults can be married off by using Matchmaker's Rings, or they will eventually get married on their own.
target_text: §l成人期§r

source_text: Leanne the Cleric
target_text: 聖職者リアン

source_text: Good, day, readers! I've written this book so that you may not end up suffering the same fate as I. Although I caught the infection, I was luckily able to keep all of my mental faculties.
target_text: 読者の皆さん、こんにちは！あなたが私と同じ運命に苦しまないように、私はこの本を書きました。私は感染症にかかったのですが、幸運にも精神的な能力を保つことができました。

source_text:
§lWhat is the Infection?§r
I discovered a long time ago that the zombies that appear at night were once villagers! Newly infected villagers slowly turn green, feel unwell and may be unable to speak properly!
target_text:
§l感染とは何か§r
夜に現れるゾンビは、かつては村人だったということを私はずっと前に発見した！新しく感染した村人は徐々に緑色に変色し、気分が悪くなり、まともにしゃべれなくなることもある！

source_text:
§lCuring§r
Contrary to popular belief, any infected villager can be cured. Gift a villager a golden apple to cure an ongoing infection. If the infection turned the villager into a zombie already you must first weaken the zombie with a potion, then apply the golden apple.
target_text:
§l治療§r
一般に信じられているのとは逆に、感染した村人は誰でも治すことができる。村人に金のリンゴを贈ると、現在進行中の感染を治すことができます。感染によって村人がすでにゾンビになっている場合は、まずポー ションでゾンビを弱らせてから、金のリンゴを与えなければならない。

source_text:
§lCuring 2§r
Any other zombies you see unfortunately are too far gone, and cannot be cured.
target_text:
§l治療 2§r
あなたが目にした他のゾンビは、残念ながら手遅れで、治すことはできません。

source_text:
§lCuring 3§r
Zombies will take a couple of minutes to be fully cured. Villagers who were recently infected, though, and haven't had time to degrade into a full zombie, will be cured instantly!
target_text:
§l治療 3§r
ゾンビが完全に治るには数分かかる。しかし感染したのが最近で、完全なゾンビになる時間がなかった村人は即座に治癒される！

source_text:
§lWarnings§r
Villagers are highly susceptible to infection, decrease the risk of infection by building an infirmary!
target_text:
§l注意§r
村人は感染症に非常にかかりやすいので、診療所を建てること で感染症のリスクを減らしてください！

source_text: Richard the Zombie
target_text: ゾンビ リチャード

source_text:
§lIntroduction§r
Interaction is key to building relationships and finding the love of your life. I've happily written this book in order to share my knowledge of interaction, love, and, unfortunately, divorce, to anyone who may need a little push in the right direction.
target_text:
§lはじめに§r
交流は、人間関係を築き、生涯の愛を見つけるための鍵である。私は、交流、愛、そして残念ながら離婚に関する私の知識を、正しい方向への後押しが必要な人に分かち合うために、喜んでこの本を書いた。

source_text:
§lPersonalities§r
When speaking to any villager, you'll notice they have a personality. Pay close attention to this! Some people like jokes more, some love a hug. Some personalities are more obvious than others. Hover over the personality to see some hints.
target_text:
§l性格§r
村人と話すと、その村人に性格があることに気づくだろう。これには細心の注意を払おう！ジョークが好きな人もいれば、ハグが好きな人もいる。ある個性は他の個性よりもはっきりしている。個性にカーソルを合わせると、ヒントが表示される。

source_text:
§lMoods§r
Every person has a mood, which is always apparent when speaking to them. Moods can change throughout the day, and determine how likely a villager is to like certain interactions.
target_text:
§l気分§r
すべての人には気分があり、その気分は会話をするときに常に明らかになる。気分は一日を通して変化することがあり、村人が特定の交流を好む可能性を決定する。

source_text:
§lMoods 2§r
The death of a villager seems to put those nearby in bad moods. Taxing also gradually decreases the moods of everyone. Gifts and successful interactions are known to boost moods.
target_text:
§l気分 2§r
村人が死ぬと、近くにいる人の機嫌が悪くなるようだ。課税もまた、皆の気分を徐々に低下させる。贈り物や成功した交流は気分を高めることが知られている。

source_text:
§lInteracting§r
Choose wisely when interacting with a villager, based on their mood and personality! If choosing a romantic interaction, be sure that the villager you are talking to likes you a lot.
target_text:
§l交流§r
村人と交流するときは、相手の気分や性格を考えて、賢く選ぼう！ロマンチックな交流を選ぶなら、相手の村人があなたに好意を持っていることを確認しよう。

source_text:
§lInteracting pt. 2§r
Don't be annoying! Talking to someone for too long will bore them, and your interactions may stop succeeding. If this happens, simply wait some time before trying to talk to them again.
target_text:
§l交流 pt. 2§r
迷惑にならないように！あまり長く話し続けると相手を退屈させ、あなたの交流がうまくいかなくなるかもしれません。そのような場合は、しばらく時間をおいてからもう一度話しかけよう。

source_text:
§lGifts§r
Gifts are another great way to win someone's friendship. But again, be careful who you gift what. A fisherman loves fish, but oh my, don't ever gift a smelly fish to a noble lady.
target_text:
§l贈り物§r
贈り物もまた、誰かの友情を勝ち取るための素晴らしい方法である。しかし、誰に何を贈るかは慎重に。漁師は魚が大好きだが、なんと、高貴な婦人に臭い魚を贈ることはない。

source_text:
§lMarriage§r
To get married, simply gift a villager a wedding ring once you feel you have reached the highest relationship level.
target_text:
§l結婚§r
結婚するには、二人の関係が最高のレベルに達したと感じたら、村人に結婚指輪を贈るだけでよい。

source_text:
§lDivorce§r
Unfortunately, sometimes it is best to split from your spouse and move on. To do this, look for a cleric to get divorce papers. Then talk to your spouse.
target_text:
§l離婚§r
残念ながら、配偶者と別れて前に進むことが最善である場合もある。そのためには、聖職者を探して離婚届をもらおう。それから配偶者と話しなさい。

source_text:
§lDivorce pt. 2§r
Alternatively you can end the marriage without papers, they will not be happy tho.
target_text:
§l離婚 pt. 2§r
あるいは、書類なしで婚姻関係を終わらせることもできる。

source_text: Gerry the Librarian
target_text: 司書のジェリー

source_text:
§lWarning!
TOP SECRET§r
This manual is the property of William Mining Co.§rIf you are not a William Mining Co. employee, please refrain from reading this manual and return promptly to William the Miner.
target_text:
§l警告！
トップシークレット§r
このマニュアルはウィリアム・マイニング社の所有物です§rあなたがウィリアム・マイニング社の従業員でない場合は、このマニュアルの閲覧を控え、速やかに鉱夫ウィリアムに返却してください。

source_text: Ah, rose gold - a lovely combination of copper and gold that smelts into a pinkish-orange metal. Most use it as an alternative to gold for crafting rings as it is much less expensive. However, it has some interesting qualities that are easy to miss.
target_text: アオイゴールドは銅と金の美しい組み合わせで、溶けると桃色がかった橙色の金属になります。多くはリング作りに金の代替品として使用されますが、価格もずっと安いです。ただし、見逃しやすい興味深い特性があります。

source_text:
§lCreating Ingots§r
Crush some raw gold and copper ore to obtain a blend, which already shares the pinkish color of rose gold. Then, smelt the blend in the blast furnace and cast it into an ingot.
target_text: §lインゴット作成§r

source_text:
§Usage§r
Rose gold is a very soft metal, so it is not suitable for tools or armor. However, it makes for a great material for rings. Or rose gold blocks, if you're into that.
target_text:
§使用方法§r
桃色金属は超柔いから、道具や鎧には向かないぜ。でも指輪を作るのに最高だ。桃色金ブロックもいいぞ。

source_text: William the Miner
target_text: 鉱夫ウィリアム

source_text: The Community
target_text: コミュニティ

source_text: Contributors
target_text: 寄付者

source_text: Before MCA 7.0.0
target_text: MCA 7.0.0以前

source_text: Patrons
target_text: パトロン

source_text: Thank you!
target_text: ありがとうございます！

source_text: Translators
target_text: 翻訳者

source_text: Wiki
target_text: ウィキ

source_text:
%s,

It is with great regret that we have to inform you of %s's death.

Yours sincerely,
the mayor of %s
target_text:
%s

 %s'の訃報をお伝えしなければならないことは、大変残念でなりません。

敬具
市長 %s

source_text: Scram, you miserable creature!
target_text: スカタン、お前消えろ！

source_text: Ah, you intentionally smacked into me, didn't you? Just admit it!
target_text: わざと攻撃してきたのか消えろ！

source_text: Oh, please, do you honestly think I'm naive enough to believe your feeble excuse?
target_text: 信じるか消えろ！

source_text: Ouch! Spare me your insincere apologies, they won't undo the pain!
target_text: その傷、覚えてる消えろ！

source_text: Haha, nice try, but sorry, not sorry, I won't be falling for your apology con!
target_text: ダメだ消えろ！

source_text: Oh, pish posh! Blunders are part of life, my dear.
target_text: まあいい。誰だって失敗する。

source_text: Ah, fear not, young one! 'Tis but a trifling mishap.
target_text: いいか。次は気をつけろよ。

source_text: Well, well, well, what have we here? A slip-up, you say? Well, as luck would have it, I suppose we can let it slide. But tread cautiously next time, hmm?
target_text: そうだな。今回は許す。だが習慣にするなよ。

source_text: Mistakes, mistakes! They're as common as the sun in the sky, my friend. Don't you fret a second about it.
target_text: 心配すんな。失敗することもある。

source_text: Ha! A mere blip on the radar, my good lad. Carry on with your head held high.
target_text: ああ、問題ない。だが気をつけろ。

source_text: Oh boy, I've got a ton of work piled up! Gotta hustle, can't chat anymore.
target_text: やることが山積みだ。話す時間がない。

source_text: You know, as much as I'd love to keep chatting, my deadlines are looming over me. Gotta focus, you know?
target_text: 仕事で忙しい。気を散らすわけにはいかない。

source_text: Ah, I'm knee-deep in work right now. Can't spare a chat, but catch you on the flip side!
target_text: やることに追われてるんだ。また後でな。

source_text: My oh my, the workload is consuming me! Gotta put my nose to the grindstone, catch ya later!
target_text: 申し訳ないが、仕事が呼んでる。また今度な。

source_text: Blast it all! I left my brewing stand unattended. Must dash, but we'll catch up soon, I promise!
target_text: あ、別のことに取られちゃった。また後でな。

source_text: Man, it's scorching in this desert! But hey, at least we never have to deal with freezing our butts off in the winter.
target_text: この砂漠、焦けるほど暑い。でもな、冬の凍りつきを心配しなくていい。

source_text: Life in this bone-dry desert ain't no walk in the park, but thank goodness we have this village to keep us hydrated and fed.
target_text: 砂漠の暮らしは楽じゃねえが、この村があるから食べ物と水には困らねえ。

source_text: This desert is like a permanent sauna, always warm and toasty.
target_text: この砂漠は常にサウナだ。いつも温かい。

source_text: Ugh, this desert heat is merciless! I'll forever be rocking a deep-fried complexion or a crispy sunburn.
target_text: げ、砂漠の熱はえげつねえ。日焼けするか、焦げちゃう。

source_text: Who needs air conditioning when you have the desert nights? The stars are like a free light show and it's cooler than an ice cream parlor.
target_text: 夜の砂漠は涼しいぜ。星は無料のライトショーだ。アイスクリーム屋より涼しい。

source_text: Holy smokes! Today's sun is on a mission to turn us all into human french fries.
target_text: マジか！ 今日の太陽は、人間をフライドポテトにする勢いだ。

source_text: Goodness gracious! What on earth is up with the sun today? It's like a fiery ball of fury.
target_text: げ、太陽はキレてやがる。火の玉のようだ。

source_text: Yo, have you spotted any rabbits around here? Those sneaky buggers are like desert ninjas!
target_text: なあ、このあたりでウサギ見かけたか？あいつら砂漠のニンジャみたいだぜ！

source_text: Let me tell ya, living here means dealing with those pesky husks. They smack you and suddenly you're hungrier than a pack of wolves! It's ridiculous!
target_text: なあ、この地で生きるのは、ハスクってやつがいるから大変だ。殴られてすぐに、狼みたいに腹が減る。マジウザい。

source_text: Ouch! Stepped on a cactus the other day, and boy, did it let me know who's boss. Gotta watch your every step in this prickly paradise!
target_text: あ、この間、サボテンを踏んじゃった。凄い痛かった。この地は、足に気をつけなきゃいけねえぞ。

source_text: Did you seriously just say that? Oh my goodness, I can't even begin to comprehend the level of absurdity in your words.
target_text: ちょ、ちょっと待てよ。何言ってんだか分かんねえぞ。

source_text: Excuse me? Pardon me for my bluntness, but your words have managed to reach a level of idiocy that I never thought possible. Bravo, I suppose.
target_text: すんません。お前さんの言ったことは、頭おかしいぞ。賞賛ってとこか。

source_text: What is wrong with you? Why are you talking about this? Seriously, what is going on inside that head of yours? It must be a never-ending circus of nonsensical thoughts.
target_text: 何だよ、お前さん。なんで変なことを。お前さんの頭はサーカスだ。

source_text: I've heard harsh things about you, I can kinda see why they think that. So, apparently, people have been saying some not-so-nice things about you. And I must say, I can definitely see where they're coming from.
target_text: 君について変なこと聞いたよ。そりゃあ、みんながそう言うのも分かるな。みんなが君について悪く言ってるんだ。そりゃあ確かにそうだと思うよ。

source_text: Not even zombies will talk to you. Congratulations, you've reached a new low in social interaction. Even the undead have higher standards than to waste their time with you.
target_text: お前さんなんぞ、ゾンビにも相手にされねえ。社会的に終わったな。

source_text: Oh, how delightful! Another mind-numbing conversation to add to my collection of boredom.
target_text: あ、つまらん話をまた聞かされちゃった。退屈の荷物箱だ。

source_text: Excuse me, but I seem to have misplaced my interest in whatever you're saying.
target_text: おい、すっかり忘れた。お前さんの話になんて。

source_text: You know, I've heard that silence can be a valuable skill. Maybe you should try it sometime.
target_text: 沈黙って貴重なスキルらしいね。君も試してみたら？

source_text: Your babbling is like nails on a chalkboard, except I'd rather listen to the nails.
target_text: お前さんのけたたましい話は、黒板を爪でひっかくみてえだ。そっちの方がいい。

source_text: Well, aren't you just a captivating conversationalist... said no one ever.
target_text: あなたは魅力的な会話者ではありません…と言った人はいません

source_text: I don't believe it exploded on its own. Well, isn't that just the most unbelievable thing I've ever heard. Bravo, you've managed to impress me with your wild imagination.
target_text: 爆発が自分で起こった？ あ、最高に面白い。さすが、想像力がいっぱいだ。

source_text: Pardon me, but I have this incredible ability to tune out the sound of drivel. Congratulations, you're a prime candidate for testing it out.
target_text: 失礼だけど、つまらない話を聞き流すのが得意なんだ。君は私の練習台にぴったりだね。おめでとう。

source_text: Oh, please, spare me your tedious words. I have much more important things to ignore.
target_text: おい、退屈な話だ。他にやることがいっぱいあるんだ。

source_text: You know, you're not that cool. Oh, aren't you just the epitome of uncoolness? I can practically feel the lack of coolness radiating off of you.
target_text: おい、お前さんはそんな凄くもない。全く凄くねえ。雰囲気が出てねえよ。

source_text: Show off. Look at you, strutting around like you're the center of the universe. Newsflash, nobody is impressed by your pathetic attempts to impress.
target_text: あ、自慢か。頭ぶって、宇宙の中心みたいに振舞うなよ。誰も見てねえぞ。

source_text: You should be thrown in a dungeon! Oh, what a delightful suggestion! I wholeheartedly agree, you deserve to be locked away for eternity with no chance of escape.
target_text: 君は牢獄に投げ込まれるべきだ！ああ、素晴らしい提案だね！心の底から同意するよ。君は永遠に逃げられない場所に閉じ込められる価値があるんだ。

source_text: Ew. Go away, you dress like you're from the past. Oh, honey, your fashion sense is just tragic. It's like you raided a dusty old attic and decided to wear whatever you found.
That is such a dumb thing to talk about. Wow, congratulations on reaching a whole new level of stupidity. Your lack of intellectual capacity is truly astounding.
